newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Computershare wins Cyprus exchange deal.
newsitem.headline: Computershare wins Cyprus exchange deal.

text.p: Software developer Computershare Systems Pty Ltd said on Wednesday it had signed a contract to supply an automated trading and settlement system for the Cyprus Stock Exchange (CSE) to replace its current open outcry system.
The CSE required Computershare to provide a ready-to-operate system servicing the CSE's 20 member firms who would operate initially from a central trading hall, Computershare said.
Computershare Systems Pty Ltd is 49 percent owned by Computershare Ltd. It did not specify the value of the contract.
The Cyprus system was based on Computershare software already installed in the Shanghai, Jakarta and Surabaya stock exchanges and the Moscow and Kazakhstan interbank currency exchanges.
The system was also recently selected by the Helsinki Stock Exchange.

CSE President Dinos Papadopoulos said in a Computershare statement the automation of the exchange was a key step in its expansion plans, "giving us the capacity to diversify the instruments traded by adding futures and options at the appropriate time."
"There will be additional opportunities for the listing of foreign securities and offshore companies," he said.
